name: Protein Pancakes
description: Fluffy, high-protein pancakes made with oats, banana, and protein powder. Perfect athlete-friendly breakfast.

instructions.instruction: Blend rolled oats in a blender for 15-20 seconds until flour-like consistency.
instructions.tip: You can also use store-bought oat flour.

instructions.instruction: In a large bowl, combine oat flour, protein powder, coconut flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. Mix well.
In a separate bowl, mash the banana thoroughly. Add eggs and whisk together.
instructions.tip: Riper bananas with brown spots are sweeter.

instructions.instruction: Add milk and vanilla extract to the wet mixture. Whisk until combined.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients. Fold gently with a spatula.
instructions.tip: Don't overmix - a few lumps are fine. Overmixing makes pancakes tough.

instructions.instruction: Let batter rest for 5 minutes. It will thicken slightly.
instructions.tip: Don't skip this step - it makes a big difference.

instructions.instruction: Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add a tiny amount of coconut oil.
instructions.tip: Pan shouldn't be too hot - pancakes will burn outside and stay raw inside.

instructions.instruction: Pour about 1/4 cup batter per pancake. Wait for it to spread naturally.
instructions.tip: Smaller pancakes are easier to flip and cook more evenly.

instructions.instruction: Cook until bubbles form on surface and edges look set (1.5-2 minutes). Flip.
instructions.tip: When bubbles start popping, it's time to flip.

instructions.instruction: Cook the other side for 1-1.5 minutes until golden brown.
Keep cooked pancakes warm in a 170Â°F oven or under foil.
Repeat with remaining batter. Serve with fresh berries, nut butter, or a drizzle of honey.
instructions.tip: Top with Greek yogurt for extra protein.

tips: Adjust liquid based on your protein powder brand - some absorb more.
Best consumed within 30 minutes post-workout for muscle recovery.
Use certified gluten-free oats for a gluten-free version.
If batter is too thick, add 1-2 tbsp more milk.
Chocolate protein powder + banana combo is a kid favorite.
storageInfo: Refrigerate for 3 days, freeze for 2 months. Reheat in toaster or pan.
servingSuggestion: Serve with fresh strawberries, blueberries, sliced banana, and a spoonful of peanut butter.
variations: Chocolate version: Add 2 tbsp cocoa powder.
Banana walnut: Add 1/4 cup chopped walnuts to batter.
Cottage cheese: Blend 1/2 cup cottage cheese into wet ingredients.
